      • shuffle

        public static int[] shuffle(int[] a)

        Shuffle the contents of an array

        This method is from the StdRandom library, and it randomly shuffles the contents of a given array
        Parameters:
        a, - an array of integer values to be shuffled
        Returns:
        a, the shuffled array

      • changeVolume

        public static double[] changeVolume(double[] array,
                                    double volume)

        Change the volume of music

        This scales an array of values representing music
        Parameters:
        array, - an array of double values
        volume, - a double to scale volume by
        Returns:
        the new array with higher or lower volume

      • harmonic

        public static double[] harmonic(int pitch,
                                double duration)

        Create a harmonic chord

        This adds the lower octave and the higher octave of a root note
        Parameters:
        pitch, - an int representing the hZ
        duration, - a double, the time to hold a note
        Returns:
        the new harmonic chord

      • delay

        public static double[] delay(double[] a,
                             double volume,
                             double seconds)

        Delay an array!

        This delays a section of music to create an echo effect.
        Parameters:
        a, - the original array to be delayed
        volume, - the new volume of the echoed array
        seconds, - the time by which to delay the original array
        Returns:
        the new array which includes the echo

      • fadeIn

        public static double[] fadeIn(double[] array,
                              int seconds)

        Fade in some music!

        This fades in an array, so the volume becomes increasingly louder.
        Parameters:
        array, - the original array of doubles without the fade filter
        seconds, - the integer time over which to fade in
        Returns:
        faded, the array of double values with the fade in effect

      • fadeOut

        public static double[] fadeOut(double[] array,
                               int seconds)

        Fade out some music!

        This fades out an array, so the volume becomes increasingly quieter.
        Parameters:
        array, - the original array of doubles without the fade filter
        seconds, - the integer time over which to fade out
        Returns:
        faded, the array of double values with the fade out effect

      • minorChord

        public static double[] minorChord(int pitch,
                                  double duration)

        Play a minor chord!

        This creates a minor chord given a root note.
        Parameters:
        pitch, - the int value to be the root note of the chord
        duration, - the time to play the minor chord
        Returns:
        the minor chord

        This creates a major chord given a root note.

        duration, - the time to play the major chord
        Returns:
        the major chord

        public static double[] pitch(double hz,
                             double duration)

        Play a pitch!

        This creates a pitch given the hz and duration.
        Parameters:
        hz, - the double to be played
        duration, - the time to play the pitch for
        Returns:
        a, the pitch

      • sum

        public static double[] sum(double[] a,
                           double[] b,
                           double awt,
                           double bwt)

        Sum notes!

        This performs weighted addition of notes.
        Parameters:
        a, - an array of double values to be summed
        b, - an array of double values to be summed
        awt, - the double to scale a by
        bwt, - the double to scale b by
        Returns:
        the newly summed notes

      • clip

        public static double[] clip(double[] array,
                            double max,
                            double min)

        Clip a song!

        This clips a portion of audio so it can't go higher or lower than a certain point.
        Parameters:
        array, - the original array of double values to be clipped
        max, - a double, the maximum value
        min, - a double, the minimum value
        Returns:
        the clipped array

      • trim

        public static double[] trim(double[] array)

        Trim zeroes!

        This trims an array of leading and trailing zeroes.
        Parameters:
        array, - the original array of double values to be trimmed
        Returns:
        trimmed, the array of double values without leading or trailing zeroes
